title: Bug 3666: Hungry code assist eats too much code
description:
Bug 3666: Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)
Under certain circumstances code assist eats too much code.
Consider the enclosed class.
As a programmer, I must add a parameter to the baz call in bar to make the program correct.

Steps:
1. UI can decide whether it wants to use the code assist end position (until the end of current identifier) or the cursor location it used to start with, so as to control the amount of source to replace. Removing code assist option.
EB: The expected behavior is that the code assist should only complete the first part of the method call 'x.foo()'. It should not include the second part 'x.foo()'. The code assist should suggest 'baz(x.foo()'.
SR:
To reproduce:
1. Change the baz call to
	baz(x.x.foo())
2. Place the cursor after the first 'x.'
3. Press Ctrl+Space to bring up code assist
4. Type 'f' to filter the list
5. Select 'foo()'
